openconnector

Class JsonBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • openconnector.JsonBuilder

  • public class JsonBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for rendering JSON.

    There are other utilities for this but they seem over-engineered. This just gets a generic Map/List/String model through JSON. If you want to reflectively serialize arbitrary Java classes then use something else.

    Dates are rendered as strings, but they do not parse back as dates. The "secrets" list was added to automatically obfuscate map keys that typically contain passwords. This is necessary since this is almost always used to serialize objects for debug logging, and seeing passwords in the log raises all sorts of alarms.

    • Field Detail

      • SortMapKeys

        public static boolean SortMapKeys
        A global flag controlling whether we sort map keys before rendering. This is normally false. It is intended for the unit tests that want to compare JSON renderings with previous renderings stored in files. Changes in JVMs can change the iteration order of map entries. In particular 1.5 Hashmap order appears to be random, but in 1.6 the keys come out sorted. By forcing them to render sorted we can use the same test files with different JVMs.

        It probably would not hurt to leave this on all the time, we should not have many large maps?

      • DATE_FORMAT

        public static final java.lang.String DATE_FORMAT
        Date format we render. !! Need to think more about the canonical syntax.

      • render

        public static java.lang.String render(java.lang.Object o)
        Public interface to rendering something as a JSON string. A null value returns a null String, not the JSON string "null".

        For debugging it is important that we render as much as we can so this does not throw exceptions if it counters something it does not understand.

        The static interface is convenient, but if you need to set options like the Secrets list, you have to construct one and use the interface methods above.
